milestone.event: Designed the C-10 programming language for the UNIVAC-I(with Betty Holberton)

Club Ace.quote: Whenever I see anyone reading a copy of Science Fiction, I gloat silently over the fact that I get my thrills not vicariously but through actual experience.

Club Two.quote: You get so tired of having your work die. I just wanted to make something that people would actually use.

Club Three.quote: If the web can be evolved to include the missing APIs and have better performance, developers won't need to go beyond the web.

Club Four.quote: I'm the rare engineer who says the answer is obviously Z. It makes me a dangerous person to employ in IT but a useful one.

Club Five.quote: People think of security as a noun, something you go buy. In reality, it's an abstract concept like happiness.

milestone.event: Created the C shell for UNIX

Club Six.quote: We have to encourage the future we want instead of trying to prevent the future war fear.

milestone.event: Designed the Apple II, the first mass-market microcomputer

Club Seven.quote: In the end, I hope there's a little note somewhere that says I designed a good computer.

milestone.event: Developed XMODEM, a simple file transfer protocol
Co-founder of CBBS bulletin board, first bulletin board brought online

Club Eight.quote: I patterned the software after the cork board and push-pins type of bulletin board, and coined the term "BBS" for it.

Club Nine.quote: Unix is basically a simple operating system, but you have to be a genius to understand the simplicity.

Club Ten.quote: Knowledge management is about using information to formulate the right problem in the first place, a tremendous and often unrecognized challenge in itself.

milestone.event: Designed the compiler for the IBM Stretch, one of the first supercomputers.

Club Jack.quote: A very big step was not only identifying parallelism, but identifying useful parallelism.

milestone.event: Invented the neural network and the first self-learning machine
Invented the first head-mounted graphical display

Club Queen.quote: No computer has ever been designed that is ever aware of what it's doing; but most of the time, we aren't either.

milestone.event: Developed computers that could crack Nazi encryption

Club King.quote: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.
